title: Issue 341
summary: MAUI, Design, Github Actions, Charting, Monetization - so much!

items.description:
G'day everyone, welcome to issue #341 of Weekly Xamarin - a wrapup of the Xamarin and MAUI communities this week. Some interesting posts on Github Actions, design topics, and charting in MAUI.

Wishing everyone a safe week.

❤

Kym
items.description_markdown:
G'day everyone, welcome to issue #341 of Weekly Xamarin - a wrapup of the Xamarin and MAUI communities this  week. Some interesting posts on Github Actions, design topics, and charting in MAUI. 

Wishing everyone a safe week.

❤

Kym

items.title: Setting up CI for your .NET MAUI iOS app in Azure DevOps
items.description:
Continuing the posts about setting up Azure DevOps continuous integration (CI) for your .NET MAUI app - but this time the focus is on iOS apps.

Setting up CI for your .NET MAUI iOS app in Azure DevOps by Andreas Nesheim
items.description_markdown:
Continuing the posts about setting up Azure DevOps continuous integration (CI) for your .NET MAUI app - but this time the focus is on iOS apps.

items.title: Intro to GitHub Actions for .NET
items.description:
Developers that use GitHub for managing their git repositories have a powerful continuous integration (CI) and continuous delivery (CD) feature with the help of GitHub Actions. In this post, you’ll learn how GitHub Actions can improve your .NET development experience and team productivity to automate common .NET app dev scenarios.

Intro to GitHub Actions for .NET by David Pine
items.description_markdown:
Developers that use GitHub for managing their git repositories have a powerful continuous integration (CI) and continuous delivery (CD) feature with the help of GitHub Actions. In this post, you’ll learn how GitHub Actions can improve your .NET development experience and team productivity to automate common .NET app dev scenarios.

[**Intro to GitHub Actions for .NET**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/dotnet-loves-github-actions/) by [David Pine](https://twitter.com/davidpine7)

items.title: Properly Manage Background Tasks in Xamarin Forms
items.description:

items.description_markdown:

items.title: The Biggest (Overlooked) .NET MAUI Feature: Single-Project
items.description:
It's easy to forget that maybe the best feature of .NET MAUI apps is the single project approach. You still have all the power to write platform-specific code, but things like managing your image resources becomes so much easier. In this video I will give you an overview of what the single-project approach means and how it will help you!

The Biggest (Overlooked) .NET MAUI Feature: Single-Project by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
It's easy to forget that maybe the best feature of .NET MAUI apps is the single project approach. You still have all the power to write platform-specific code, but things like managing your image resources becomes so much easier. In this video I will give you an overview of what the single-project approach means and how it will help you!

[**The Biggest (Overlooked) .NET MAUI Feature: Single-Project**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=shj53JXbgb8) by [Gerald Versluis](https://twitter.com/jfversluis)

items.title: The many ways to monetize your mobile & desktop apps
items.description:
James talks about making money with your mobile and desktop applications for iOS, Android, macOS, and Windows. He breaks down paid apps, non-consumables, consumables, subscriptions, and some tips and tricks!

The many ways to monetize your mobile & desktop apps by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
James talks about making money with your mobile and desktop applications for iOS, Android, macOS, and Windows. He breaks down paid apps, non-consumables, consumables, subscriptions, and some tips and  tricks!

[**The many ways to monetize your mobile & desktop apps**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d2hKN_VZmig) by [James Montemagno](https://twitter.com/jamesmontemagno)

items.title: Merge Conflict: 295: Two ways to do the same thing
items.description:
What to do when there are new APIs that improve but don't deprecate old ones? Do you throw away your old code? Write compatibility layers? Or do you just keep on with what you have? We discuss.

Merge Conflict: 295: Two ways to do the same thing by Merge Conflict
items.description_markdown:
What to do when there are new APIs that improve but don't deprecate old ones? Do you throw away your old code? Write compatibility layers? Or do you just keep on with what you have? We discuss.

[**Merge Conflict: 295: Two ways to do the same thing**](https://www.mergeconflict.fm/295) by [Merge Conflict](https://twitter.com/mergeconflictfm)

embedded_links.title: **Merge Conflict: 295: Two ways to do the same thing**
